Posts.EditableText:
a 'working' library is impossible, as everyone's game is different. You got to do some work to implement any library into your own game. The best libraries, just make it the easiest to implement into your game, but you got to do that implementation.

here's the location of them:

http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/samples

and here's some/most/all of Pixie's libraries/guides transferred over to github:

https://github.com/ThePix/quest

-------

there's Pixie's Combat Library (3 main versions of it: v1.0, v2.0, v3.0), which I think combines his combat + equipment + magic libraries, Pixie's equipment/clothing library (2-3 versions of it), Pixie's dialogue/conversation library, Pixie's shopping library, Pixie's clock/date/time library, Pixie's level (stat/attribute/character creation/lvlup selection) library (2 versions of it), Pixie even made his source code (or at least some of it - not sure if full or part code - hadn't looked at it yet) for his uber amazing'deeper' game available too, and many many more... (Most libraries/code samples are Pixie's)

there's Pertex' Combat Library ( http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/samples/topic/2660/library-rpg-elements )

and there's my combat code based upon Pertex' combat library ( http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/quest/topic/3348/noobie-hks-help-me-thread#22483 and http://textadventures.co.uk/forum/quest/topic/3348/noobie-hks-help-me-thread#22486 )

there's Sora's Stackable (item) library

there's Chase's wearables (equipment) library

there's Jay's (Jaynabonne's) random map generation libraries, there's Jay's conversion libraries, there's Jay's uber advanced 'spondre' (jumbled form of "respond" --- conversion/dialogue) game and even its source code is also publically available too, and more libraries/code-samples that I'm foregetting

there's many more libraries too... just scour through the 3 pages of the link at the very top (the 'libraries and code samples' forum board)
